t5y2k8byqiZi5Xg32_nBAQ.text: Queens!!!! Probably the best soul food place in Charlotte. I enjoyed every single thing on my plate. The turkey wings was the best I've ever had in life. Everything was so well seasoned. Had a chance to meet the owner Tony aka "Bubba" very hospitable. I can't say enough, go see for yourself!!

SfnG5FQjxBZhYzeyiRUwoQ.text: Recently visited with my family. We had the Flounder, chicken and ox tails. All were very good. The sides were great. Collard greens are perfectly seasoned. I will be back. Anthony the owner has a great personality.

p9rHNXioYsL1F21IIG98mA.text: This food is delicious,  I  don't  know  what  these  other  reviewer's  are talking  about, and my dad is a chef and so is mom so believe  me; I know good  food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bakec turkey wings, lima beans, and dirty rice.

L_cd5TAYjCIDC0cRM3iR1A.text: The food was excellent reminds me of my mom  cooking the staff was very friendly will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food so good started the eating before I took the picture

9SB0Q7_BLFc1qILaZm-btw.text: Stopped in during lunch and was very surprised. It's always the places of the beaten path that has great food. Queen's had exactly what I was looking for. Great food! Only bad thing is that I didn't come sooner! I will be back.

uxXasCCRlWywlHx4T8bl-Q.text: I came here hoping for some great soul food; mediocre at best. WRONG! It was terrible. I went with the smothered pork chops because all other options looked...sad. I also got the collards and mac and cheese. The collards were "eh" and the Mac and cheese was "bleh". My boyfriend got the fried chicken and complained that it may have been sitting in water at some point. Amazing service and friendly people but I was not impressed with the meal. The only thing that made the trip worthwhile was the cake. AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! I will be back for the cake...maybe.

X0155ffetCMB531vHu3GNA.text: Customer service was really good- owner is comedic. Too bad the joke's on us with the flavorless food. The collard greens had too much vinegar, a dash sugar could balance things out. The yams were strange and syrupy and the macaroni with cheese appeared cheesy, yet tasted too greasy with butter. Corn muffin was soft and sweet and the bourbon chicken was tasty. Drinks come with meal and the meals range from $9-$11 depending on two/three meats/sides combinations.Also, one stalled restrooms with no changing table.  Doubtful to return even if someone else was buying...

so9PoxAbfKbMi7xCgnEXbA.text: I waited until my third time to review. The food is pretty good..chicken is ok, greens are heavy on the vinegar, potato salad is ok, but the mac & cheese is pretty lackluster, which kinda hurt my feelings. There is one lady who gives significantly larger portions than the rest, everyone is typically nice. In short, it'll do- but it ain't Grandma's.

trgXSc7kmKrrKLXWJykG5g.text: After hanging out in Charlotte for Christmas shopping. We needed a place to take the load off and rest ourselves. We noticed a family favorite restaurant that serve ala carte but we saw this restaurant off in the corner. Deciding to risk it all, we tried this restaurant.Best Choice. Great layout, spouse had the baked chicken and I had the bourbon chicken.  Excellent flavor. Fresh vegetables and sides. We approve of this restaurant.

Y0Wi3e2Xw24Jef7P5V4QdA.text: Great Southern cooking with very friendly service. Had Sunday lunch, the freshly fried catfish was excellent. Good mac'n cheese, alright collards. Yams were savory and sweet. Fried chicken was nice and crispy, the dark meat was better, the white meat was a little on the tough side. Good home style soul food at very good prices.

alY8qtzhcA98-lTYkPwSeA.text: Unbelievably good!!! Went there on my day off after hearing my co-workers rave about the place. Decor is reminiscent of a Chinese Buffet, but very clean and orderly. As soon as you walk through the doors you hear a welcoming chorus of 'Welcome to Queen's' even before you see the workers there! The food is, in a word, INCREDIBLE!!! I have been disappointed at just about every soul food restaurant that I've went to since I moved here, EXCEPT this one. I had the smothered chicken, Macaroni & Cheese, Jerk Chicken, Yams, and Homemade Mashed Potatoes and Gravy with Red Velvet for dessert. Everything was just wonderful; well seasoned but no overkill of any one season, not oily, under or overcooked. The owner was very friendly as well; he was the one that wrung me up and even gave me a pound after asking if this was my first time here. Just an all around great place; well worth hard-earned the money I spent.

VJ879tIuGC3AZqLX8-w3Ng.text: First time being in here and was very very impressed! Great selection of food to choose from and everything was made fresh today. I had the meat loaf yams and green beans and it was wonderful!!! Will definitely be back here again for lunch! The staff were helpful and funny just like family!

9qqtxOYKcM3zs0Hk2DpAqA.text: Great food, even better service. Tilapia was hot and fresh. Collard greens and mashed potatoes were delicious.

Un5c4P03qXozOmX2YQvG0g.text: Decided to go to Queen's off of the reviews and I am so glad I did. I had the fish with mac/cheese, and greens it was so so good. My daughter had fried chicken, mash and green beans my mother had jerk chicken, greens, mac/cheese. No one complained it was all really good. Price was fair and the sweet tea was just right. This place is a hidden gem for sure. I def will be going back. Oh and the owner came over and was funny and gave us the history of how Queens came to be....

R2IJEN0-OqvJt9E9v4Ageg.text: Ive seen the sign for this soul food place several times and i'd never heard anything about it.. I was in the area and decided to stop in, the food was one word... DELICIOUS. I got the smothered pork chops and fried whiting.. and i don't know which one i liked more. For sides I got macaroni and cheese (tasted like grandmas), cabbage (perfectly cooked) and mashed potatoes (taste like actual mashed potatoes no instant mix!) The price was reasonable and included a drink.  Best soul food in the area.  The owner Tony was so nice and greets you upon entering so you're not just standing there wondering about the process.  The other employees were very friendly and patient while you decide!  Ill be going back soon to try the ribs!

wea2FwoFK6IUBg4j30Ghng.text: Still the best soul food in town.  We have now been several times and have never had a bad experience or a bad meal.  It is troubling to read so many poor reviews when I know how well the food is prepared and how attentive the staff is.  While I am certainly no soul food expert, the food tastes awesome to me and my family and we do eat out quite a bit.  This used to be a Chinese buffet so the decor is not outstanding but it is a clean, comfortable, delicious dining experience with many, many choices and combinations for a great meal.  The desserts are also excellent.

qufyTEqmZNjaCF-pcQto6w.text: Best soul food in town..the staff is very friendly,  my yams and macaroni was perfection...best seasoning  fried chicken,delicious jerk chicken, oh and Salisbury  steak was the best also...recommended to all you !!!

dZUkrJZe9wWbNW9OSsH6-g.text: Customer Service was great, can't complain about that everybody was so friendly and the location was good.  BUT the food was -it was just awful I hate to say it.  No flavor if they could just try and put a little love or something to their food this place wouldn't be so bad.  Do yourself a favor train your current cook or hire someone to help him.

FII5tSTX4BhabIvqKgDslw.text: Great food and exceptional management. I have been going here every since it opened at least once a week. Nice portion sizes.

EeW_hwdmZpbC0GpcVNgcaA.text: I loved this place ! I am from up north (Pennsylvania) and came down to visit with my boyfriend. This was he week of thanksgiving. We heard from a friend that they were open thanksgiving. We did not have a hotel with a kitchen so obviously we needed to buy out. They had the friendliest welcome, made us laugh and feel comfortable. Their food deals are well worth it since they fill you up and you'll even have leftovers if you buy the large plate. The food was amazing ! It hard to go to just any " soul food spot " but this one was great ! The cornbread was a little hard and dry but the rice was pretty good my boyfriend had meat loaf, jerk chicken, collars greens and mac and cheese. He was in heaven and it met his expectations. I had jerk chicken, ham, rice with gravy, and mac and cheese. It was so good we went a second time before leaving. Instead, we shared a large plate. My boyfriend got the whiting fish (a huge one at that !) and the regular sides. Their lemonade was perfect !! I had about 3-4 cups I would def be stopping back once I visit again. I did not get the young mans name but he was super nice and very polite. They noticed us since we stopped by for he holiday which we felt welcome once again. I def recommend this place !

pXx2bAyp16gxTwrDA7Bqdw.text: So.... I went to this place on a Saturday evening.  I love soul food and I am always willing to try new places.  However, I was so disappointed with this place.  The place looks run down in the inside.  But I didn't want judge based upon the inside because some of the best food are in a hole in the wall.  So I ended up taking a 2 wing plate to go.... and I got Mac and cheese, and collard greens as my side. Once I got home...I was excited to try the food.  And I was so disappointed.  The mac and cheese was so nasty that I almost vomited while tasting it.  The collard greens was okay. And the chicken lacked any type of seasoning.  Needless to say.... I ended up having to get food from somewhere else.   This meal was a waste of my money.  And I will never be back here. Just gross!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Looks can be deceiving.  Food was not good

-s9IHWFrOPQFJkzJFDIt-w.text: I stumbled across Queens one day when working in the area. I love coming to Queen`s the food and employees are always the best. I try to find a reason to go to east side just to eat here.

kw0l-2VL-7gRJ4OdWORaUg.text: Ain't no way in the world I am going back.  My wife and I went for the first time and we both got baked chicken.  She got cabbage and I got greens.  The chicken was very dry and had very little flavor and the veggies had very little taste as well. The staff was so very friendly, which just so happened to be the best part of the whole experience.  Too bad you cant convert friendliness into great food.  So disappointed.  I wanted a place near home that could be my go-to spot.  I guess I have to keep looking.

NP5ukbVhGmBn-eBSfaPZAg.text: It was ok. The food is pretty good. Not as good as some places. The service was ok, seem like everyone had an attitude and didn't wanna be there.

DTEGCsI0c2mCBBMnYK6rvA.text: I'm a vegetarian and look hard for vegetables with seasoning. Being in the south if you can go to big mama's house, that's always #1. But Queen soulfood is a good 2nd place. Nice and friendly service and very clean establishment.   I had mac and cheese, pinto beans and cole slaw. Everything was great!  I'll definitely be back!  Good luck surviving beside one of the oldest restaurants in Charlotte...People had change in the south.

ioxZ7tFPwNu54wq5G8hslQ.text: The food was very good and I was so pleased until I found a long hair in Greens.  I had to discover it in my mouth.  Eat the greens with caution.  Not okay at all.

iaHWwTH_EFgQFZrzfpekbw.text: When this place first opened, it was very good... just like authentic "soul food". The owner/manager is friendly and funny, and he'll tell you stories and try to remember you when you return, which helps to make you feel welcomed.  Although this is my first time writing a review on this restaurant after visiting several times, I was a little disappointed recently when I stopped on my way home from work.  It appears that if you come too late (or right before they close), you'll likely get what's left over unless you order a meat that has to be prepared upon request, like a kind of fish.  I guess it's a hit or miss, depending on when you go and what you prefer.  However, there are plenty selections and I can't seem to find a better soul food spot in the area that competes with this one?

LmPw6KfX2QkeVKPvFq6CCw.text: If I don't have a chance to cook dinner Bc of my schedule, I always go to Queens Soul Food!  Great owner, great customer service, and really good food!

_HCOJiYjrFhawxB_feMJzA.text: The place is raggedy. The food is not fresh tasting. The host is okay butto  talkative. I had bourbon chicken and it tasted like they just poured bourbon in it and heated it up. I'm sorry, I'm not going back.

Tmz8nY3ZX_wKna8JtFPrSA.text: Visited Queen's after chuch Sunday since I was in the area.  It's cafeteria style meat and 2 or 3 sides.  I was a little disappointed with the food here........I ordered the smothered chops, cabbage, and potatoes...my son had the ribs, mac n cheese, cabbage, and a side of catfish.  The majority of the food had very little seasoning but especially the cabbage......the mac n cheese, potatoes, and the catfish had very little taste so needless to say I won't be returning to Queen's in the future.

CCUzEfHWRAp-31-GJyGYjQ.text: I am very unsure why there are recently low reviews. I found this spot about 3 or so months ago and have visited about 3 times. The food is awesome. This is the best soul food restaurant that I have been to in Charlotte. Bland? Not at all. The food is seasoned very well, as soul food should be. Maybe it depends on the day that you go. But each time I have been it was absolutely great. The staff is awesome and the owner is accommodating. Queen's is GOOD!

fFSO3NZ-SAYaKxuL6voe7w.text: I visited about two weeks ago.  Food was good and manager was very visible and personable, apologizing for no AC.  They had plenty of fans so was pretty comfortable.

PkhsKtbhVi_nKg2_p7lx5Q.text: I was was in Charlotte for the night, and wanted some soul food and someone recommended Queens.   I ordered the bourbon chicken, the curry chicken, macaroni and cheese, and collard greens.   As I sat down and started eating, I realized I had made a terrible mistake.   I don't know if it's because it was so late and the food was just sitting there all day, but the food had no flavor   it took me back to one of my childhood rap songs by Sugarhill Gang, " the macaroni soggy the peas are smushed and the chicken taste like wood.  And baby Bubba I did not recommend this place!!!!!!!!!

1FV2PptGrP-SGjfHZQf_kw.text: Just left this restaurant. EVERYTHING  WAS DELICIOUS including the gravy that I got on my finger tips. It was like my dear mother was in that kitchen.And my mother could make pots and pans sing.She could really do the cooking thing. Mama  are you there in thekitchen. Great atmosphere and hospitality. Well done.

EFtRwprvVDyExeV35M58BQ.text: Don't know what's happened to their mac and cheese but it is not good anymore. That was a disappointment

iiJ367uivZiEfWT0Z9uSTg.text: Delicious food, fast, courteous staff and owner!!! We got here at the last minute and they welcomed us in. Food had not been laying around and was top notch!!!

9TQ-lt7A85_5sEEFLK8gaw.text: I ate here one time on a whim because my husband said he used to eat there when he was a kid. It was very good food for good prices. The atmosphere and cafeteria style is pretty outdated.

YKJxwvkdMfQDgcCxBe2mlQ.text: My top 5 favorite soul food places in the country.  The food is great and the option of meals unlike any other place I've visited.  It is cafeteria style i.e. you have to bus a tray around, but the food is delicious.  The place is not a high end restaurant with waiters, elegant decore, and soft music.  However, what they lack in asthetics they more than compensate in the deliciousness of their food.  If good food is your focus this place is a must!

AhoeiN5DLxjiBtK9yrEa1g.text: I was traveling through from Texas and found this spot! AMAZING! Great food! Excellent service! Met and talked with owner. Made my night! Highly recommend!

hE-j6VfZndVt6JRCWdWOMw.text: The food was great, and the owner was really entertaining. The service was great and very friendly. No lie I didn't expect much when I got there. Byt definitely a good find, and definitely succeeded my expectations. If you go, definitely get the smothered porkchop, fried okra, and mac and cheese.

NG5RgCSw1GfYI-20jFgy8A.text: The food is amazing! I had the bourbon chicken, Mac n cheese, with greens! YUM. The owner was super sweet and made sure once your got through the buffet style selection you paid and were on your way!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

usD01KikyRXuTWvjdPPWgg.text: Just had lunch. I had the oxtails for the first time delicious.  Everything was great. Seasoned well. Generous portions I will definitely go back.

e2duHEpp9O83wGjcr6MQWw.text: Cafeteria style, no fuss. Good foooood though. Like good. We went on a Sunday at noon and it was packed.  I got a small plate of the fried chicken, mac and cheese and cabbage. It was more than enough to fill me up. Would totally go back.

syTdBh5lFp0nY9EaZMfEKQ.text: Great Food!  Food is not over seasoned with great flavor.  Genuine cooking recipes.  If you want more info on this place read the reviews on google 300+ at 4.6 stars.    The best thing about this place is not the food but the inspirational story of the owner.  I would suggest having a chat while eating in and learn about the life of this person growing up.  It will definitely put you in a state of mind to be grateful of your life and pursue your dream.  Absolutely and exceptional person.    Will be back for sure!

vCc5IaPeOWxk6UgJVhNkQg.text: First time eating here was years ago. I was just visiting at the time now I decided to recently go try it again and I love it! Beat soul food in Charlotte I had yet far. Details details details! This isn't some rushed food that some through together in one day. If they do they do a damn good job at it because it taste like it was made overnight with LOTS AND LOTS OF TLC! Every bite is finger licking good. At 1st being from the north I thought K&W was soul food until I tried this. It was love at first sight I even went back the next day! Keep up the awesome work with this hard working dedicated team!

y3Zol27qIJIvyIvVXEvAxw.text: I go here all the time. I usually get my order to go but I think they give you the best portions for your money of any soul food restaurant in the city. The soul food spots I've been to are (Floyds, Nana's, Mert's and Lola's). Queen is by far the best if you ask me. Friendly customer service and great food, nice prices. What else could u ask for and I think they have the best variety of food on a daily basis.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

5NQTsFxbAeY3FS_ryvpM0w.text: I love this place!  Home cooking big portions and friendly owner. My favorite are the yams, collards, Lima beans, fried chicken, smothered pork chop, potatoes salad.... I haven't had anything that wasn't good. Every time I've been in there there is a line to get food and the place is always full of police officers, firemen etc.  that to me is always a good sign.  It is not a fancy restaurant but the food is good and consistent.

YWSrZlFlNUsycag7s0VTAA.text: Was here in town with a large group, we were all talking about getting some soul food. I scouted out Queens and decided even though the reviews say I shouldn't.   We ended up ordering a three Veg plate, which included mac & cheese, greens and yams. The food was overall a five out of 10. The mac & cheese was so so , The greens had too much vinegar  and the yams were so so too.   What really bothered me was I paid seven dollars for Soso food and small portions with no meat.  The container was small size not your regular size to go container.   Only one small cornbread muffin instead of two.  The portions were dished from a small scoop, and practically leveled off.  In summary trust the yelp reviews, I cannot recommend this to the rest of my group.   I hope Queen reads their reviews and make some changes because I want to see black businesses succeed.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. The picture makes the portions look bigger than they are trust me they were small. This is yams greens and Mac

wIkTUeimvyxyOjHqCtB49g.text: Today was my first time visiting and the food was delicious. Mr. Tony came out and greeted his customers he was very personable. I would definitely go back to enjoy his conversation and good food

9c76YqL1oSNDbGRmR0ui9Q.text: First time in North Carolina and wanted to try local cuisine. I was very surprised at how authentic the food was. I ordered oxtails and they were delicious. Reasonably priced. The owner came over and spoke with us. We were very comfortable.

MnSsqn2NDPsHIOnvRrbOxw.text: This was our first visit, because of uncertain reviews we almost missed this!  It's more of a laid back inner city atmosphere.  The food was good, the greens.... man, I'd go back just for those!  And the customer service can't be beat.  Not sure if he was the owner, an Asian gentlemen, but my God that man, even if the food wasn't good made us feel so welcomed!  Such a difference, made sure to check on us, thanked us when we left, and they were busy!  I had baked chicken with gravy, mac & cheese and my greens.  My husband had the fried catfish and BBQ chicken, yams and black eyed peas.  I'm getting my own fish next time!  Food was great!

9TtNe0MqKjqXSDUpRMVWnA.text: Best Mac n Cheese in Charlotte hands down!! Costumer service good, n they dont skimp on the portions.  Dont leave tips for the servers as they do not receive them. Was informed that's management requires them to turn in any tips made at the end of the day into the register to be added to the store's sales for the day :/

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n cheese, fried chicken,  n cabbage...they give good portions too

U0j9s-q_zC1N4HcrDZ2v4w.text: Great food and great owner,,the owner was very inviting and came to talk with us to make sure the experience was great,The food the workers and the owner were all number 1 to me and my husband

HjP06NzGWR7eEIZyeFQHNw.text: Queen's Soul Food is fanTABulous. Tony, his wife and their entire crew (I apologize for not knowing their names) love their customers. They have always provided excellent service and the food is OUTSTANDING!!! There's another restaurant directly beside them and when I tell you, the excellent service was NOT there, nor the tasteful food. Forever a Queen's Soul Fool customer. If you have a taste for some great soul food, please visit Queen's Soul Food on Independence Blvd.

TkaEnYEwzTB5hPTzDidO6Q.text: This was probably the worst food I've ever had. I really wanted to like this and I hope maybe I just went on one of their off days. The mac and cheese LOOKED good. The taste was the exact opposite. It literally tasted like they put water in it. There was cheese, but you couldn't taste the cheese. The noodles were overcooked. It was ridiculous. The fried okra was not seasoned, at all. The corn muffin looked gross, didn't even try it. I fed it to the ducks at freedom park. The tilapia was half decent, again, it wasn't seasoned though! Very bland. The mashed potatoes and gravy weren't only thing I finished. They were honestly the only thing half way edible. I'm from the north and was really looking forward to southern soul food. Disappointed. The ladies were nice though.

nnhPVlMZnlHkYpA7hLeoOA.text: Here is the breakdown of my first visit to this place . First it's not authentic Soul  Food. Second the owners are friendly and comical they will make you feel welcomed. Third The food is decent but not great so don't expect miracles. Fourth don't leave tips urban legend has it that it goes to the owners not the restaurant workers. Fifth while the customer service is friendly the food is not something you can't find anywhere else. I would not recommend going out of your way to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish, collards and Mac and cheese.

j_T7fKpFlm5as4b6W--RYg.text: I really enjoyed my meal here! Fried chicken dark, Mac n cheese, candied yams and roll were all HOT and delicious. Good value with the lunch special. Service was slightly slow but very friendly and courteous!!  Heard server ask customer behind if he never wanted bread or just today, as if she would remember for him next time. Server and manager came through the dining area to welcome customers and recognized new faces and actually held a conversation beyond the typical "manager check". The atmosphere is what you would expect from a small strip mall restaurant.  I think the quality and value of the food paired with the friendly welcome more than makes up for it! I will be back and bring work friends.

utXjxlCuQe12agPSj3uBBQ.text: This is a seriously overlooked gym in The Queen City. We came here after reading about it in the Charlotte Agenda. This place should be packed wall to wall with a line out of the door. There is $7 lunch special that's 1 meat, 2 sides, cornbread or a roll (get the cornbread!!!) and a drink. I think it's regularly $9. The food is fresh and flavorful. The yams are perfect. No, for real, perfect. The banana pudding and apple cobbler are bomb, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Plate ($8.50) Catfish, Mac n Cheese, Yams and Cornbread + drink

7SnE_ns73EAk6jjsGiA6lg.text: Nice little spot if you want to just chill out and talk. Not eat, if you want soul food that's has no soul. Creamy Mac n Cheese, come on now! My husband is from Dominica says the jerk chicken is a flop. I'm not a chef but I know soul food and there's a spot on South Tryon that gets the job done. So everyone has a bad day in the kitchen so maybe another day. But for today it is what it is.

TByXNQOiNtuuZ7rKO7TH-w.text: I went this week. Ordered the  fried chicken special. The chicken is not seasoned. The potatoes were very salty. On the way out, i saw the sanitation grade. 81! Avoid this place.

f7_alANmU6KjYEiy8aIT_g.text: Love love LOVE this place amazing soul food! If you have the time get the ox tails, have had any this good since my grandma made them for me. The fried chicken is my staple here I go to this place at least once a week. Everything is delicious! The owners are super nice and a lot of fun. They really enjoy seeing there customers happy and it shows how much they take pride in there restaurant. Will be back sometime this week for the yams!

_IGqCfSBhRGr9GsH9-GazA.text: I am sooo trying to figure out what food everyone else on Yelp was eating at this restaurant  because they were not serving it last night.    Honey...where do I begin.  Okay, so the place is pretty clean.  However, apparently during the day with all the serving the covers for the food containers had become covered in food and were not being regularly cleaned so that looked disgusting.  The ladies behind the counter were pleasant and attentive.    We ordered one small plate and one large plate.  For the small plate we ordered fried chicken, double fries, and it came with cornbread.  The chicken flavor was average at best.  The breast was dry from sitting on the steam table for way to long (or from being over cooked).  The fries were fries, but it wasn't a double order, which is what we ordered.  If that was a double order then they must give exactly 7 fries for a regular order.   The cornbread just isn't right.  Yucky!  The flavor is trying to do something but is failing.  SMH!  The big plate was tilapia, shrimp, Lima beans, collard greens, fried okra, and that nasty cornbread.  The tilapia and shrimp (and my sons fries) were made to order which is good to do.    The shrimp had a good flavor but I was only given four.  The menu shows eight was to be given.  I didn't realize this until we got home and opened the container.  The tilapia breading had no flavor!  WTH?!!  Hot mess!  Just use the same breading as on the shrimp if you can't come up with anything else.   The Lima beans were ok as were the collards.  The okra was ok as well.  The portion sizes on the sides were way to small.  So many comments were about portion sizes being big....what happened last night?  It was exactly the opposite. Ok, tired of typing.  But I've got to tell you about this red velvet cake before I finish.  The cake itself was pretty good, but these people had the audacity to use some sort of bootleg icing on it.  Tasted like birthday cake icing.  How are you gonna mess up the cake and use crappy icing?    This place should hire a new chef.  Hire somebody's grandma from Alabama, Mississippi, or the like.  I would highly recommend not going to this place.

jA3iP6vkFTa5JgMT4_2IVQ.text: Hands down the best soul food I've ever had that wasn't cooked in someone's house. I was sure that it was owned by a local family but come to find out it was owned by a gentleman who used to be good friends with Queen Latifah's grandmother.. hence the name Queen.. I'll put it to you this way. This place was so amazing I went back for seconds the day I was leaving town to fly back to KY. They had the best fried chicken and their side fixins were top notch. I personally couldn't get away from the black eyed peas and macaroni and cheese but they had everything from collard greens to fried okra to mashed potatoes. They had it all. The cornbread was perfection as well. The people that work there were absolutely delightful both days I went. They play 70s/80s funk and Motown hits and for those of you that know me... those are my jams and what I grew up with quite a bit. Great experience all the way around.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

AJ6NOW8HP-ePKcfQkexhSw.text: This place is okay, nothing spectacular. The food was warm, not hot because it's sort of on a buffet line type thing. I got a large plate (2 meats, 3 sides, cornbread/roll, and drink for $12.99) with fried chicken, bourbon chicken, macaroni & cheese, collard greens, and mashed potatoes with gravy. The collard greens were sweet which was different to me. The atmosphere could have been better. One employee walked through the dining room talking on her phone extremely loudly while we were eating. The banana pudding was just like any other banana pudding, not home made and mediocre. The sweet tea was pretty good. Don't think my family will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

KEfY06T1eu-yzJHYqGQPaw.text: Absolutely delicious!!! We wanted some fried chicken and somehow stumbled across this place. So glad we did! The fried chicken, cabbage, and Mac and cheese was on point! Let me say it again.... absolutely delicious! I definitely will be back!

9vi8nOae9vyBeUj5EnM_rw.text: There food is not the best soul food. I just think they may be average at best. The best part about this restaurant is the beatiful girl who works up front. I could make her my wife. Holla at me boo .  Prices are kind of high. But it's in a good location in Charlotte.

iuUw-BQr4P-UWj8uGA5Q0Q.text: After 4 years, Queen's Soul Food never disappoints! Mr. Tony is the best host!  My food was fresh and well seasoned as always!

aQwf8RR3rBLZfuot1PI6zg.text: The food here is really good and the staff is really welcoming. The jerk chicken is so tender literally the meat comes off the bone. I am very pleased with this restaurant.

5OcIJ5iG2lGGSfQTczxRJg.text: The owner takes ALL of the tips, the employees NEVER see those tips! Restaurant has a bad roach problem I witnessed bugs in food after working with the food. Cooks do not use gloves when preparing your food! They also use food from the day before and tell you it's all fresh. I've witnessed so much working here it has completely deterred me as a customer and quit eating the food as I witnessed the way they handle the food. If you like making minimum wage and don't get your tips and no discount on meals oh not to mention the slave driver who will cuss and completely disrespect you while your working and not to mention no breaks and no weekends off then this is the place for you. This place is a complete hole on the wall with no value of its employees. Labor board was called because he didn't pay overtime. Employees are overworked and under appreciated.

E2-FZEzpq7kz9yUsmjk4-Q.text: It's crazy how much food you get for the price! I love how I can tell the greens aren't canned and the mac n cheese isn't the cheap, tasteless, runny kind you'll find at a Chinese buffet. The customer service is great and they're always welcoming.

RSl7H55FRI7DK00_E7-phQ.text: We were in Charlotte for only two nights, and LOVED Queens so much we had to go twice.  The fried fish was perfect - crispy, flakey, and not at all greasy.  AMAZING  curried chicken.  Fantastic greens, and Mac and cheese.  I only wish I could have tried every single thing!!

71o6WYVR5xJTMYVUsrwwCg.text: FOOD IS AMAZING!!!!!! OX tails are a must when you come!!!!! This is not a restaurant, this place is home!!!!! Good food even better company!!!!

dZV8VPpAD2ASYFoKrEOFFw.text: Best Soulfood I've tasted!!!Staff is friendly and courteous!!Very Clean. Owner greets ALL his guest. Definitely a must try.

lNdFg82OAw0RKGOIJx4MJQ.text: If you love Fried Chicken, Mac & Cheese, Ribs, Corn Bread, mmmmm ... this is the spot to check out! Service was beyond great and portion sizes were wow!!! Talk about big feast. My family and I are from Los Angeles, California and we have not come across anything like this yet. This one of the best spots to eat with family. Fast food with great service even had the owners come out to see how everything was doing. 5     . Thank you again. Next time we visit Charlotte will be sure to stop here.

IFWoKvzPsa2sYU-3auZnoA.text: High recommend this place is you in this area , clean great food and fair price . I will back soon for more

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baked chicken is great too, flavorful and spice
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very taste , I love the chicken curry from this place

0YNCNlwWKuD52RhZtTXa7w.text: Great Food!!! Great Service!!!  Truly southern soul food.  Just as you remember at family reunions but healthier.  Best of all Great Prices. Food ready for you at all times with seating to suit you. I come regularly and have never been disappointed. ENJOY!!! MT. Traveling sleuth

0IcMQECL1_fIGEI6oBtmdQ.text: The food was amazing. I had the lunch small plate with collard greens and yams. Oh my! The catfish was cooked to order. My entire family loved their selections. Overall, we had the meatloaf, fried chicken, and catfish. The peach cobbler is ok. This place is definitely worth checking out.

HTSRvVG-B5PLRJpSbUQS0w.text: Ox tails were seasoned good with a dark gravy broth, however they were not tender and pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Oxtails, rice, cabbage and green beans. $14 w/tax  Oxtails were tough green beans fresh and cabbage bland.

BVNxeShHQbc3E6D-IJOZEQ.text: AMAZING!!!!! First time here and will be here EVERY Sunday. Owner is AMAZING! The food is the best soul food I have had in Charlotte! If I could leave 10 stars I would!

DWHEoepwxfylOrZ0oMD22w.text: I was looking for someplace different to eat my birthday dinner and didn't want to go uptown. Since this was less than 5 miles from my house i decided to try it. It was a Sunday night maybe a little less than a hour before closing and I must say, EVERYTHING was hot, fresh and delicious. They even fried fresh chicken wings for the lady in front of me. Mr. Tony came out and greeted us and asked if we were satisfied. I was more than satisfied. It was so good even my step son told me it was better than my cooking. Nothing needed extra salt or pepper, it was perfectly seasoned already. This is my new go-to soul food restaurant. Thanks Mr Tony!!!

YKtBzeSM3vCSUxoemvR0aQ.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant with family in town, so we stopped in for lunch. I was a little skeptical at first...no frills about it at all. The customer service was less than stellar but nevertheless, we were hungry. We got our food, sat down, and after the first few bites we realized it was more than worth it!   Now I go all the time! I know not to expect much in terms of customer service. Some associates are much friendlier than others. The food seriously makes up for it.   It's a small place and gets crowded quickly, especially on Sundays after church. They have lots of choices and the prices are good!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

DFDLRfd4VvRTs4q6Hf8ZuA.text: Very good! The owner was very friendly, and even though they told me that the whiting that I ordered would take a while, it did not seem that way. Mac and Cheese portions were generous, and the fish was fried PERFECTLY. I ordered collard greens and they tasted exactly the way my dad used to cook them, huge plus! The cornbread was slightly sweet, in a good, subtle way. My husband and I will definitely be back here :)

ap_AtTXYca3HY2aAGQ78IA.text: Food that touches my soul!  After my second visit, I'm ready to make my review here.  It can't get any better.  Ever now and than I may want fried chicken.  Today was that day.  I got a large plate with fried chicken breast, bourbon chicken, and 3 sides (mac n cheese, mash potatoes, cabbage, and corn bread.  The fried chicken was everything my soul desired at that moment.  The bourbon chicken was good but I realize the bourbon is only on the skin which I don't eat unless it's fried.  Cabbage was delicious and so was the cornbread.  I added my own raw honey and sweet n spicy bbq sauce as condiments.  Mash potatoes today were a little lumpy but not bad and mac n cheese was fine.  Good value for the money and includes a drink.  There's a wide array of desserts.  I usually get the pecan pie.

JNezcHlkZUPxKjPgtAtYow.text: Great food and great service!!!! Me and my family will be back. G great place to visit after church!!!  Great meeting you today Tony!!!   Del

v_WWto43h_LJNIo3eXbmrg.text: I love their food. Their food is seasoned well and the price is not expensive. I love a place that is affordable. The customer service is amazing; you are greeted when you walk in and served immediately. I would recommend.

2Wi-90n0JM6NCP-VFNsPqg.text: 3.5 stars. My daughter and I decided to try this place out. Our initial impression of the restaurant and location was that we'd better get our food to go. I didn't particularly care for the strong smell of what I assume was cleaning agents when we walked in. I couldn't eat with that smell surrounding me.  I had baked chicken with rice and gravy collard greens and corn bread. It was good, especially the collard greens, but the gravy on the rice was completely tasteless and the cornbread was yucky. I didn't like the taste of that at all. Overall it was a pretty good experience, but not sure I'd go back.

GPJVULRufE6jSBRFRBIJVw.text: We came across this restaurant by accident and the sign outside intrigued me. So we decided to have lunch here. We ordered the small lunch: 1 meat, 2 sides, bread or a roll and a drink. Large was 2 meats, 3 sides etc. The small lunch cost $9.50 and the large lunch costs: $12.99  Dishes included  varieties of chicken, pork, fried fish  choices and a multitude of sides to includes lots of vegetable dishes as well as their famous  mac and cheese. The every day  daily special was oxtail. I ordered bbq chicken, lima beans and coleslaw. My dining mate ordered jerk chicken, cooked cabbage and lima beans. We both got the cornbread. We choose water as our beverage but tea, lemonade and soda available. The menu also features cake,  cobbler, pudding and pie for dessert. A friendly lady dished out our choices which we brought to the table. Portions were good, served on melamine type plates  with flat ware. Just homestyle cooking. All  very good but nothing extraordinary with what we ordered. Our chicken was moist and tasty, as were our sides. The cornbread was moist very unnatural yellow and I think they must add  either an egg shade food color to the recipe or use a commercial mix. The restaurant was clean but needs a brighter upgrade. We would probably eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. about Queens soul food
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. jerk chicken. cabbage, Lima, cornbread
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. inside table view

HQwVLf8H314cyFbndGbWqA.text: Wonderful soul food hole in the wall joint with impeccably good food. Wonderful menu with many great foods. Please do yourself a favor and get your treat today.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States. Excellent soul food restaurant if you&#39;re in the Charlotte area! The food is absolutely wonderful!

YZ3lMYMtqS-Dv_wulFJ5qw.text: Service was great and food was fantastic. I loved the Mac n cheese and the jerk chicken took me back to Jamaica. Nice spice, good flavor! I'll definitely stop back when in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

ulAthY62SiLcArjJHPv5Fg.text: One of my most favorite, if not my favorite place to eat. I absolutely love Queen's! The fried chicken and bourbon chicken are always so good & crispy. They make the best yams and collard greens. The food is always so fresh and hot. The owner is always there and he is always so nice to all of his customers. He greets everyone when he's out. One of the nicest people. I will forever love coming here for takeout. The prices are great too. I'm going to try some dessert next time.  Update: it's still my favorite!!!!

AyBqM1EwFYTnc7mzWV8ijg.text: From walking in, eating my food, until leaving, the entire staff were professional and very attentive. I ordered the whiting small plate, which comes w drink. Fish was cooked to order and perfection. With a side of lima beans and super cheesy mac and cheese..yum! I ate it so quick forgot to take a picture lol. Ill definitely be back!!

Y9PFS2zGkCbBETsNZ2IJog.text: i got a small plate to go and it is so delicious. i stopped eating just to type this review. i ordered the bourbon chicken with yams and mac and cheese. you get a choice of cornbread or a roll and i got cornbread. the cornbread i is a little crumbly but the flavor is amazing. the bourbon chicken and sweet and sticky and i love it. the yams are sweet and seasoned perfectly. the mac and cheese has good flavor too. (i like to mix it with my yams)  all around pretty good food. it is also a good amount too. i paid about $10 which isn't bad but i would like to try the ox tails. i just wish they weren't $14 /:

ZE9NOX4d1l8CEE0PIysTOg.text: Food was very disappointing and expensive for the quality of the food. Not the type of soul food i was expecting

gY2brd6mb63b90Gby-i4Ag.text: This place is good if you are just looking for food other than you average fast foods. Needs updated bad! Great customer service doe. I will return if I'm not looking for real bake Mac n cheese. Their Mac n cheese is just that. Nothing soul about it.

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

EBiXztF1muTrqIPYCQuJrw.text: My husband wanted Soul Food for his birthday and we went to Queen's Soul Food. The food was delicious and we left very happy and full.

3rbKkX_oyaZmPBr9dafOcw.text: First time visitor,,,,,food was nice and hot and well prepared, restaurant has a homely atmosphere and feeling,,,workers and owner was very friendly  and nice. All meals was priced fair, definitely a place to revisit

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

rxKrdBcjLTNH_Ek-wpAUwg.text: Was really good had curry chicken with greens yams mashed potatoes and jerk chicken with lemonade I will definitely be back and try other things they have

photos.caption: Photo of Queen's Soul Food - Charlotte, NC, United States

HjDqnmyCkmgCFubbLOWviQ.text: Some good old fashioned soul food. Stopped in randomly and was pleasantly surprised. Nice variety. I had the catfish. Made nice and fresh.

PeUT7YA2yeKljHsj_pb2aA.text: We've visited here twice now, my college aged son cannot get enough of the food here. They always give him a portion fit for his appetite. Both times I've been the service was great. Ive had the jerk chicken, bourbon chicken, fried chicken, yams, greens, cabbage, green  beams, corn bread, and macaroni and cheese. All the sides were prepared using seasoning and vegetable stock. I subtracted a star because the second time I went the food wasn't seasoned the same. Consistency is important. My second visit was during the night shift during the week. My first visit was right after lunch. There was a difference, even the corn bread tasted different. I tried the banana pudding, which was really good. We will return and I will try something different next time. Everything is really good.

T04icGthBv7EoRzRQQRi-g.text: First and last time going. We went as soon as it opened and the lady fixing our food had the rudest attitude! The only good thing was the meat nothing else.

XAD8igA-3oGU80VasuP8JA.text: Value does not meet quality. This restaurant was recommended to me as a great soul food place. Sorry, many other places in CLT far outrank this one. Limited options of sides which were "okay."  I ordered the small plate white meat chicken- the avg tasting breast & a rubbery piece of cornbread is all you get for a whopping $10. I'll make my drive to South CLT LaWan's, Nanas & even House of Prayer before returning here. They do have unsweet tea which is sometimes hard to get.

YF8EWGta6dksrn-b7w7iNw.text: OK I don't get why this place is getting such a bad rap. I stopped in last night and the server was super friendly and eagerly told us what all they offered since it was our first visit. I had a large plate: meatloaf, tangy soft and delicious. The jerk chicken was my favorite with just the right amount of kick, and so tender it was falling off the bone. The yams were sweet and soft, macaroni and cheese was cheezy, buttery bliss, and rice with brown gravy. Oh and their corn muffins?! I could eat a plate of them. Seriously. The food wasn't overly spiced, which if you bring your kids, is a great thing, but it still had plenty of flavor and was cooked to perfection. He owner was so friendly, he came out to ask us about our meal and apparently remembers my hubby from 10 years ago when he came in while it was still an Asian buffet. I'm from GA born and raised, and for those of us that love good home cooking and can't find the time to make it, this is the perfect place. I plan on stopping by today. I had leftovers for breakfast... Yes it's that good. Next time though I will go with a small plate, because the large was enough for two meals.

sIBwJt0CykRa5UnUYmw19w.text: I fought the boyfriend about where to eat and we ended up here and I wasn't disappointed! I had the fried chicken with mashed potatoes and Mac n cheese! Oh my gosh!! So delicious!!! The staff is beyond friendly and takes the time to show you all your options. The staff really helps make this place along with delicious food! Defiantly a must try!

OJvBfyq46v3nJlx_LLvIeA.text: The food and service were excellent here. The owner truly cares about what people think which will go a long ways in providing a good experience. The prices are reasonable. Overall this has been a good dining experience which I suggest everyone e try. If you love soul food this place is a must!

Ji0q-vIOiKtCV-x0BwpJkg.text: The first time I ate here I was lost turned the wrong way and found this establishment just thought I wad hungry so I said  I needed to give it another try.  My husband and I came a second time and all I can say is  Both times we're yummy to my tummy.  They give you plenty of food and the staff is very nice and attentive.

W0wz9GtcEpYexoFnsVZMHg.text: Finally a great soul food restaurant in the Northeast/Matthews area.. now all of us over here don't have to drive to the Southside for soul food. The ribs, mac-and-cheese, and catfish were delicious. Good presentation of all the other food that was available. The staff was so personable and made sure to check on every customer when they had the time. Great atmosphere! Low R&B/Old School Soul played in the background.. was also told about live Jazz that they have on Monday nights. Definitely will be back and recommend as well.

rtvvMnig3nyY3P281vD1fA.text: As far as soul food goes, I would put this up against any place in driving distance. Very delicious. Great cornbread, meatloaf, several great chicken dishes. Sides were very well done: those yams cannot possibly be good for you but they were delightful. We've been back twice and found it consistently great and affordable. Recommend.

vPabiu54rUKvpLUe0Q9C0w.text: I just started a new job a few miles away from this place, so I decided to stop by on my way home from work. I guess there was reason why I had forgotten my credit card at work, God was warning me not to stop at this place. I had great expectations going in because it was so many people going inside & coming out with numerous amounts of to go plates, but looks can definitely be deceiving. I love, love, love soul food, but this is not soul food. I ordered the bourbon chicken, mac & cheese & collards. Everything was so bland & disappointing. I wanted to like it so bad, but couldn't eat it after 3 bites. The cornbread & sweet tea was very delicious, I was so excited to taste everything, but the disappointment infuriated me. I couldn't believe I wasted $9 on subpar food. Nonetheless the customer service was fantastic. They're all very nice & friendly, but the owners could definitely invest in a new recipe. I don't think I'll be returning.

uKVdZnLywR53wAlHkBD2pQ.text: Great food, great prices! Karaoke during the weekends! Plenty of food to choose from.. :) would recommend this place to anyone who loves home cooked food!

2bO5dkIjHnv68pCWjDfP4w.text: I wish I had read the reviews previous to my encounter. I wonder who the owner is or whether they have any inkling of the taste of "soul food" , because this is NOT it. Owner/Operator has to be accountable...makes me wonder if they have had "Soul Food", or if they really appreciate it for what it represents? Tasteless to me!
